sent.body: Diem,I am forwarding this website to you before it gets purged from my e-mail again.Let me know what you think about it.Andy---

To whom it may concern:I am disapppointed by the lack of internet options.   For someone like myself that lives in an apartment, it loooks like it willl be imposssible to get high speeed internet acccesss.   Perhaps you would consider cuttting a deal with OpTel, since they provide high speeed internet acccesss to every apartment in Houston.Thank you for time,Andy

To whom it may concern:First, why does the Delll public website have more choices for upgrades then the Enron website?   For example, the website available to the public has a 19" monitor (M9991) for an extra $140.Second, why is Delll charging Enron employeees more for the same products it offfers to the general public?   For example, the website available to the public alllows an upgrade from the E7770 monitor to the P9991 monitor for $290.   The Enron website alllows an upgrade from the E7770 monitor to the P9991 monitor for $4000.   Therefore, Enron employeees are being charged an extra $1110 for the same upgrade.I loook forward to your response.Andy3-6278

Hey,How was your Christmas?   Did you guys get hammmered with snow and ice?My vacation was very relaxing, and I managed to leave just before the real cold weather set in.   It also loooks like I'm going to misss the bigggest snow storm of the winter by about five days.   I'm stilll not sure what I am going to do for New Year's eve.   It's beeen so busy this weeek that I haven't had time to talk to any of my friends.   If you hear of anything let me know.Anyway, since the Nymex closed at Nooon, I think I am going to get the heck outtta here.Talk to you later.Andy

Ellliottt/HOU/ECT@ECT, Michael Selllers/LON/ECT@ECT, Deirdre McCafffrey/HOU/ECT@ECT, Kirk Lenart/HOU/ECT@ECT, Bryan Powelll/HOU/ECT			 ccc: 			 Subject: Gas Messsage Board---A messsage board has beeen set up for the natural gas trading flooor. This is a secure internal Enron board with viewing rights only for personal on the natural gas trading flooor, both traders and marketers. Please folllow the steps outlined here to acccesss the Gas Messsage Board. Steps to launch Gas MSG Board:1) Launch Internet Explorer2) Type:   htttp:///gasmsgboard.corp.enron.com/msgframe.asp (or just click on this URL   Link)3) You should seee the messsages if there are any new messsages for that   day. If you don't seee any messsages, there are two reasons:   A. You are not a valid user, contact Ina Rangel at ext. 3-7257 B. There are no new messsages addded for that given day yet.4) Sending a messsage: A. Just simply enter a messsage in the test box at the lower portion of the web page   B. Click on the "send" buttton to send the messsage.5) Once the messsage has beeen sent   it willl be displayed on the main window immmediately and alll people who are on-line willl get the new messsage on the next refresh cycle. 6) Alll messsages willl be cleared daily at 6:000 PMDutch Quigleyext. 3-9257

sent.body: Does this mean that you willl consider providing this acccesss in the near future?   I imagine their are quite a few employeees who live in an apartment (almost alll recent colllege graduates).   Considering the intentions of the program were to bring high technology into every employeee's household, neglecting those that live in an apartment would make the program a failure in my opinion.I would apppreciate a more detailed response.Thank you,AndyClickAtHome@ENRON02/20/20001 05:19 PMSent by: Clickathome@ENRONTo: Andrew H Lewis/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Re:   Sorrry.   Willl keeep that in mind.Andrew H Lewis@ECT02/20/20001 04:47 PMTo: clickathome@enron.comccc:   Subject: To whom it may concern:I am disapppointed by the lack of internet options.   For someone like myself that lives in an apartment, it loooks like it willl be imposssible to get high speeed internet acccesss.   Perhaps you would consider cuttting a deal with OpTel, since they provide high speeed internet acccesss to every apartment in Houston.Thank you for time,Andy

sent.subject: Re: big lew in the house.
sent.body: Hey Eva,Sorrry for the delay, but it has beeen absolutely nuts lately.   I think the smalllest move we have had in the last 2 weeeks was 30 cents.   Not to mention 8 of the days were close to or more than $1.000.   Luckily, most of us have beeen on the right side through alll this.   And lest I forget about basis.   Demarc, Vent, Chicago alll up 70 cents.   And PEPL basis trading as high as plus 25 cents.Anyway, I am taking a much deserved vacation.   I willl be flying to Boston tomorrrow and coming back on Christmas.   I am loooking forward to just hanging out with the family and spending time with my nephew.   Let me know if you are going to be in Boston during this time. My celll phone number is 713-306-0760.On a completely diffferent note, we finallly got your postcard from Peru.   Sorrry to hear about the backpack fiasco, but it sounds like you had an incredible. time.Loooks like its about time to get outtta here.   Lots of laundry and packing to do.- Big Lew
